direction.raw_text: Pitch dark. We hear two men speaking FRENCH in hushed voices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : All dialogue is in French until otherwise noted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) Turn on the flashlight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm trying.    It doesn't work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It has to work. You just bought it this afternoon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do they come with batteries?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't buy batteries?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought they came with batteries.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't believe you didn't check.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I bought everything you put on the list. Gloves. Pen knives. Flashlight. Batteries were not on the list.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why should I have to put it on the list? It's like saying to buy a car with tires.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE -- NIGHT A wealthy neighborhood of Paris off the Champs Elysees. Large homes line the secluded street. We see the silhouette of a man in a Peugeot. We MOVE IN closer to see RAYMOND GAYET, 30's, waits nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DARK ROOM -- NIGHT Dark. DANIEL FORAY lights his Zippo lighter. He is late 30's, tall, handsome with eyes that seem to twinkle in the glow of the flame. Beside him is JULIEN LABESSE, 30's, hyper. Daniel places the LIGHTER on a small table and moves over to a PAINTING on the wall. Daniel stops at one, removes a pen knife and starts to cut the canvas from the frame. Daniel rolls up the canvas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julien starts to pick up the ZIPPO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too Late! Julien has already picked it up. It burns his hand ans he flicks it away. It flies through the air and lands in the corner of the room. The CURTAINS catch on fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julien panics! He grabs the canvas out of Daniel's hand and begins beating the flames with it. Daniel looks at him with disbelief. Julien flails his arms wildly as he beats back the flames. He turns to Daniel pleased that his efforts have extinguished the fire, but unaware that the canvas has now caught on fire. A beat. Julien sees the flames and puts them out. Daniel just stares at him. He opens the canvas. The painting is ruined.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be careful it's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... hot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mercedes parks in front of the Peugeot, boxing it in between it and a car behind it. The DRIVER gets out and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE FOYER -- NIGHT Daniel and Julien move through the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julien remove a lighter and presses it. The entire room fills with light. Julien stares at the flame amazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn to see an old man standing at the top of the stairs in his bathrobe. He is frail, his face pasty white. He is holding a very long, double-barrel shotgun. Julien looks to Daniel with a 'what now' expression. The old man slowly moves down the stairs. He loses his balance and falls down the stairs, tumbling head over heals until he reaches the bottom. Daniel and Julien stare at the old man who is sprawled out on the floor, motionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old man groans, then opens his eyes.    He grabs his shotgun. Daniel and Julien run to the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Light your lighter. I can't see anything... and try not to burn down the house!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't move!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is he dead?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.     He looks dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He looked dead before he fell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE -- NIGHT Daniel and Julien run towards the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raymond starts the engine.   Daniel and Julien rush across the street and get in the back seat. Raymond tries to pull out but there are only a few inches between the Mercedes in front and the car behind. Like a pinball stuck between two bumpers the Peugeot jerks rapidly back and forth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Start the car! Start the car!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Daniel and Julien stare angrily ar Raymond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniel looks out his window and sees...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't think to move the car before we came out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- the old man runs out of his house with his shotgun and heads towards the car. Raymond is desperately trying to get the car free. They all slide down as the old man fires. The windows on the left side of the car shatter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raymond pops up and returns to getting the car out as the old man opens the breach of the shotgun to reload.. Raymond floors the Peugeot keeping his foot on the brake. The engine revs. He turns the wheel to the left and releases the brake. The Peugeot juts forward smashing into the rear of the Mercedes and pushing in out into the street. Before the old man can take aim the Peugeot is speeding down the street.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Raymond, get us out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PEUGEOT -- MOVING -- NIGHT Raymond bites his lip nervously as he drives.    Julien finds the whole thing amusing. Daniel leans forward.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Raymond) You know what makes a good get away driver? (More)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) (controlled anger) Being able to get away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're always pointing out my negative qualities. My analyst says positive reinforcement is a much more productive way of relating with people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine. Raymond, we'd like to commend you on how well you fucked up tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STREET, PARIS -- DAY A narrow street. Daniel carries the cardboard tube as he walks with Julien and Raymond. They enter a WAREHOUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BASTALDI'S OFFICE -- DAY Two large desks are lined up face to face. One is empty. The other is occupied by LAURANT BASTALDI, 40's, all business. Off to the side is MARCEL BUROT, 40's. Daniel, Julien and Raymond enter. As they approach the desk Daniel glances at Marcel who is staring at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel glances at Bastaldi to see if he appreciates his comments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat. Raymond and Marcel stare at one another.     We HEAR a muffled
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (amused) I heard you almost got your ass blown off last night. Some thief. A regular black panther.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Black Panther was a member of an African American militant group in the sixties, Marcel. I think you're referring to The Pink Panther.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pink panther, black panther. Who gives a shit? And I don't remember asking you a God Damn thing, you little turd.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's no reason to be abusive. You're projecting your anger on me as a defense mechanism.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is he talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm talking about human beings communicating openly and honestly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about getting on your knees and communicating with my dick?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up! Both of you!    You're giving me a fuckin' headache.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniel lays the cardboard tube containing the painting on the desk. Bastaldi removes the painting. To him it is not a work of art, just a commodity to be sold. He opens his desk drawer, removes several large stacks of money and hands them to Daniel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We HEAR the groaning sound again. Bastaldi looks irritated. He gets up and walks over to a closet. He opens to the doors to reveal a man in his underwear, his wrists tied behind his back, his mouth taped shut. A wire noose is around his neck forcing him to stand on his tip toes to avoid hanging himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man looks at Bastaldi through pleading eyes and mumbles something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bastaldi closes the door.   Daniel looks at him inquisitively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bastaldi looks puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bastaldi thinks about something for a moment, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniel is still staring at the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bastaldi tosses a photo of a middle-aged American couple.   He points to a diamond necklace around the woman's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They know they don't have a choice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where's your brother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vincent's in the States on business. (a beat; referring to the painting) That it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.   Now I've got something I want to --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you mind? I'm trying to do some business here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One more sound out of you and I'm going to cut your fuckin' tongue out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You take someone in. Give them a steady job and how do they repay you? By claiming to misplace a shipment of your merchandise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe he did misplace it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You misplace your car keys.   You misplace your cell phone. (More)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) You do not misplace one hundred and forty seven wide-screen TV's!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Laurant, how long has he been in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.     What day is today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thursday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it Thursday already?    This week has just shot by.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You and your crew speak English, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Daniel! Hello? (snaps his fingers) Do you guys speak English?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good.   I have a job for you in America.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Taylors from Chicago. Very rich. An acquaintance of mine recently quit working for Mrs. Taylor as an assistant. She tells me they keep all their jewelry in a safe in their bedroom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It seems like a long way to go for a necklace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Besides, we don't know the city and--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (overlapping) Mr. Bastaldi isn't asking you if you want to go. (More)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) He's telling you you're going! And if he's telling you you're going to be going then you are going to go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you Marcel, for that... extremely redundant explanation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon, Laurant, America?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The job is worth about two million euros. Pull this off and you and your crew could make some real money, Daniel. You leave tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're going to need to find someone who knows the city.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know someone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NOTRE DAME -- DAY The plaza is filled with tourists. Moving through the crowd is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Algerian, late 20's, a small time street hustler, dressed in jeans and a "I Love Paris" tee-shirt. He passes a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who is about to take a picture and lifts his wallet. Sami moves on. He sees two overweight women standing at a vendor's cart, holding a large wad of MONEY. The woman puts the cash back in her purse, but does not zip it up. Sami moves in behind her and slips his hand into the purse. She zips the bag closed. Sami's face fills with pain as the zipper catches the hair of his arm. The women walk towards the cathedral. Sami has no choice but follow after them. He tries to match their pace so he doesn't alert them of his presence. The woman looks back and sees Sami's hand. She pulls her bag away, ripping a section of hair off his arm, then swings the bag, putting all of her weight behind it. It hits Sami squarely in the face. He lands on his back with a thud. WALLETS and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fly out from every one of his pockets. He staggers to his feet and starts to pick up the wallets when he sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- ACROSS THE PLAZA:    of two police officers moving towards him . He knows he has no more time.    He takes off running, disappearing into the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAFE -- LATIN QUARTER -- DAY Sami is at the bar. He sees Marcel enter and runs towards the back. Standing in his way is one of Marcel's MEN. Sami turns around as Marcel approaches and forces a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :   All dialogue is now in English unless otherwise noted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long, awkward beat as Marcel just glares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel opens the door to the bathroom and pushes Sami inside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Going somewhere?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Marcel! I thought you were somebody else. If I knew it was you I would have never run.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're probably here for the money I owe you. (off Marcel's nod) I don't have it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BATHROOM -- CONTINUOUS -- DAY Marcel closes the door.   He is face to face with Sami.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel punches Sami in the stomach. He drops to his knees. A beat. The door to the bathroom opens and the LARGE MAN peers inside. He stares awkwardly at what he perceives as the beginning of a sexual act.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel slams the door then grabs Sami by the ear and yanks him to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel glares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel stares at him with hard expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands Sami a piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know this is how rumors get started.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Told you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Today's your lucky day, Sami.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (breathlessly) Yeah, I can see that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Normally I'd be breaking your fingers right now, but I'm going to give you a chance to make enough to pay me back and have some extra for yourself. We have a group going to Chicago to do a job. You're going with them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lived there. You know the city.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've still got a few legal problems back in the States.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nervously) But I'd be... I'd be happy to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you try to leave town I'll know. If you manage to leave town I'll find you... and the next time we meet in a bathroom I'll be cutting you up into little pieces.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be at this address at nine o'clock tomorrow morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CAFE -- MORNING Daniel sits with Julien.    At the end of the bar Raymond is on the pay phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sami enters and walks over to Daniel and Julien.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door opens. ZERO enters. No one knows his last name. He is
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in French) Yes, Mama. Yes, I have my vitamins. I have everything. Of course I'm coming back. I'm not leaving you. I'm only going to be gone a few days. I'll call you when I get there. Okay? I've got to go now. (listens) Mama, I've got to go. (listens) No, I'm not yelling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm Sami.    Marcel sent me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it you do, Sami?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, a little of this, a little of that. I've boosted cars, stole radios, run a few scams. Right now I'm into pick-pocketing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see.   A master criminal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I was told to come here by Marcel. You guys don't want me, I'll be more than happy to leave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: s, blonde hair, leather jacket, black pants. Looks more like a rock-star than a criminal. His eyes are flat and there is an intensity about him that is unnerving. Zero casually nods to Daniel. Zero stares at Sami as Daniel leads him over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sami laughs at his little joke. The others cringe. One look in Zero's eyes tells Sami what everyone else already knows: This is not someone to fuck with. Julien puts his arm around Sami and leads him away from the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sami leans over to Raymond.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Sami) This is Zero.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi. I'm one and this is two, three, four and five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me give you some advice. You don't want to piss him off because he'll kill you for the fun of it. What you want to do is keep your mouth shut and do what we tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in French) So, we are going to America?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In English.   Sami doesn't speak French.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you from?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Algeria.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you don't speak French?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you know, not all Algerians speak French. It's a matter of what school you went too. Me I never really -- ZERO (overlapping)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zero isn't interested in your life story. (to Daniel) Who gets killed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hopefully no one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confused) No one? Then why is Zero here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He speaks about himself in the third person?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Feel free to correct him if you want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Zero) I just want you there in case there's trouble.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if there is, then Zero can kill someone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CAFE -- DAY Daniel and the others step out carrying their suitcases. The door to a limousine opens and Marcel gets out. The scene is in FRENCH.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Daniel) I thought I would accompany you to the airport to say bon voyage... and tell you that Marcel will be going with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is a considerable move up for you, Daniel. The temptation of having so much money might be too much for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't trust me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't trust anyone. You don't get to the top of this game by trusting people... and after all, you are a thief. It's in your nature to steal. I'm just protecting my investment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . LIMO -- MOVING -- DAY For many of them this is the first time they have ever been inside a limo. Julien pours himself a drink. Sami plays around with the air conditioner. Zero turns on the radio and clicks through a few stations until he comes to RENAUD singing "Des que le vent souffera." He leans back in his seat, bobbing his head to the music. Marcel doesn't like it. He changes the station. We hear JOHNNY HALLYDAY singing, "Que je taime."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zero doesn't like it. He pushes the button returning to the Renaud song and stares at Marcel. Marcel, not to be outdone returns the Hallyday song. Like two children they click the buttons of the radio, switching back and forth between Renaud and Hallyday. Bastaldi has had enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns off the radio. A long beat. Marcel, like a child who has to have the last word starts singing to himself quietly, but loud enough for Zero to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel sees Bastaldi glaring at him and stops.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop it!   Both of you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) ... que je t'aime... que je...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . O'HARE AIRPORT -- MORNING Daniel and the crew get into a mini-van taxi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHICAGO DRIVING MONTAGE -- MORNING Quick cuts of the familiar sights of the city. The Sears building. Chicago board of trade building. Grant park. Then with each successive cut the beauty of the city seems to fade until we are in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREET -- MORNING An industrial section of the city. Empty streets. Run down buildings. Graffiti filled walls and burnt out hulls of abandoned cars line the street. The taxi driver leans out his window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel looks at a piece of paper he is holding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The taxi speeds off, leaving them standing on the sidewalk, their bags in a pile. Suddenly, from out of nowhere three BLACK TOUGHS appear and walk over. Daniel looks behind him and sees another two approaching from the rear. Zero calmly sits down on one of the suitcases.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you sure you guys have the right address? This ain't no tourist area.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.   We are sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me handle this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 30's, the leader of the group steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sami raises his hand as if to greet Lamar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sami looks like an idiot with his hand up in the air.   He casually lowers it. Lamar looks over the group and grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lamar forces a laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raymond steps forward and places his hand on Lamar's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lamar removes a knife. The others in his group bring out an assortment of clubs, chains and pipes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zero is still sitting on one of the suitcases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julien shrugs his shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zero stands up and raises his hand.   He is holding a .9mm Glock. He aims it at Lamar's head. Lamar's brave exterior quickly fades now that he is looking down the barrel of the gun. The rest of his gang turns and runs away. Zero aims the gun at his groin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lamar runs away. Daniel and the others smile at Zero as they pick up their bags and walk towards a building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Zero is left with Sami who stares at him with disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zero grins and walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, brother.     What's happening, man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you brother me, motherfucker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's in the bags?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dirty underwear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dirty underwear. That's a good one. Let me explain something to you. This is my street and you're gonna give me want I what or I'm gonna bust your heads open.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lamar, violence is never an answer to settling disputes. I can see you have a lot of anger... but this is not the way to get it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get outta my face!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, are you going to give me the suitcases? Or are we going to have to take them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Va te faire foutre!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did he say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said to go fuck yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are tired and bored with your bullshit. So, put that stupid little knife away before Zero shoves it up your ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who is Zero?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Julien) He speaks about himself in the third person?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe Zero would like to get off his ass and take my knife from me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you insist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave now before Zero shoots off those little raisins you call balls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You put a loaded gun in your bag and brought it through customs? How stupid is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zero did not put it in his bag.    He put it in yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . WAREHOUSE -- MORNING The crew stands at a door. Marcel knocks.     A peep-hole in the door is opened and an eye looks them over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door is opened by SOPHIE (the girl in the photo on Bastaldi's computer). She is late 20's, beautiful.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We are looking for Sophie.    Laurant send us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Ouh La La.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SOPHIE'S WAREHOUSE -- MORNING An old building, the rooms are partitioned off by sheets hanging from the ceiling. The main area is an artists workspace where large abstract paintings lean against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of to the side, sitting on the couch is WAYNE, 20's, a burn-out with long hair and a scraggly goatee. His face is buried in a bong as he sucks in a lung full of marijuana. He watches a cartoon show on the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raymond walks over to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raymond looks at the television and sees a cartoon show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SIDE OF WAREHOUSE -- MOMENTS LATER -- AFTERNOON Marcel walks purposefully along the side of the building. He reaches into his jacket pocket and removes two black leather gloves. He slips them on as he approaches the door, then knocks. A beat. The Biker opens the door.

dialogue.raw_text: Bonanno's a dinosaur. Guy thinks he's fuckin' Vito Corleone or something. The old ways are gone. If we don't change now we're going to get pushed out. I need to know if I can count on your support?

dialogue.raw_text: I knew this was a mistake! I knew it last night when you asked me to go along with this. I could hear that little voice in my head saying, "don't do it! Don't you do it!" Jesus, why don't I ever listen to myself?

dialogue.raw_text: They'll be waiting for us at the airport.

dialogue.raw_text: You steal some money from a man he gets over it in time. But these tapes. He's never going to stop looking for us.

dialogue.raw_text: I know where she went.

dialogue.raw_text: Black market art. Zammito got to a few key security guards at the Metropolitan Museum. The Bastaldi's supplied the artists to make copies of famous works. They'd switch the paintings, send the originals to Paris and the Bastaldi's would sell them to private collectors.

Zero casually picks up the suitcase filled with guns and hands it to Daniel. They walk out of the room. Lamar stands there, stunned, then quickly runs after them. A beat. direction.raw_text: . HOUSEBOAT -- FIVE SECONDS LATER The houseboat explodes in a brilliant fireball, sending pieces of wood and metal flying into the air. A thick plume of black smoke swirls in the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ACROSS THE RIVER -- AFTERNOON Daniel, Raymond, Sami, Raymond, Marcel and Zero watch the smoldering wreckage. Their blank faces show no emotion -- just a sense that justice has been done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raymond opens the suitcase and looks inside. As he peels through the stacks of money we see that only the top bill of each stack is real -- underneath them all is white paper, cut to the same size as the bills. Everyone turns to Marcel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you have to use that much explosive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promised Bonanno I'd destroy the tapes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't check it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BRIDGE -- AFTERNOON The five of them walk across the bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one answers him. Sami reaches inside the black canvas bag and removes the autographed baseball Marcel took from Zammito.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sami throws the baseball back in the canvas bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raymond's anger takes everyone by surprise.     Even Raymond is surprised by his outburst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel tries to take the ball out of the bag. Sami pulls it away. Marcel grabs the bag. Both of them tug on it. Marcel pulls hard and the bag rips down the seam. The baseball falls out and rolls off the bridge into the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcel stands there holding the inside liner of the bag. Sami throws the canvas bag to the ground in frustration. Something catches Daniel's attention.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry! I was caught up in the excitement of the moment. I should have checked. I made a mistake. I suppose that none of you have ever made a mistake before?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is great. After everything we've been through we've got eight hundred euros and an autographed baseball.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The baseball is mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! You can't have the baseball! You're not entitled to the fuckin' baseball!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm the one who took it.   It's my baseball!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you say baseball one more time Zero will shoot you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Raymond, don't you think they're over reacting a little?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I think they have a right to express their anger with you in light of the fact that you're... (something in him snaps)
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: HOW COULD YOU NOT CHECK THE MONEY, YOU GOD DAMN STUPID SHIT-HEAD

dialogue.raw_text: ! HOW COULD YOU NOT CHECK THE MONEY, YOU GOD DAMN STUPID SHIT-HEAD!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine. All of you want to be angry? Be angry... but I'm the one who took the ball and that makes it mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give it to me, Sami.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perfect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -- of the black canvas. The lining has been ripped away. A light breeze blows lifting the underside of the black canvas. There is a flash of color. Another gust of wind turns the black canvas over. On the other side is Van Gogh's "Vase with twelve sunflowers". Daniel's jaw drops.   The others notice his stunned expression and follow his stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- of the priceless painting. They stand there, too shocked to move at first, then rush forward. They have almost reached the painting when a truck passes them. The wind kicks up the painting, blowing it over the railing. They reach out to grab it, but it is too far away. They stand there, watching as it slowly floats down to the river below.
direction.name: direction
